edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings
Class SequenceFragment

java.lang.Object
  com.davidsoergel.dsutils.LabellableImpl<String>
      edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.SequenceFragmentMetadata<SequenceFragment>
          edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings.SequenceFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.davidsoergel.dsutils.Labellable<String>, edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AdditiveClusterable<SequenceFragment>, edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.Clusterable<SequenceFragment>, Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable<SequenceFragment>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AggregateSequenceFragment
public class SequenceFragment
extends SequenceFragmentMetadata<SequenceFragment>
implements edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AdditiveClusterable<SequenceFragment>

Manages information about a sequence fragment, including its metadata and any statistics that have been calculated from the sequence, in the form of SequenceSpectra. It is assumed that any SequenceSpectrum objects stored here are all derived from a single "base spectrum" (which could in the worst case be a SequenceSpectrum implementation that simply stores the entire input sequence).

Version:
$Id: SequenceFragment.java 530 2009-10-12 06:14:05Z soergel $
Author:
David Soergel

SequenceFragment

public SequenceFragment(SequenceFragmentMetadata parent,
                        String sequenceName,
                        long startPosition,
                        long length,
                        SequenceSpectrumScanner scanner)
Constructs a new SequenceFragment by specifying its coordinates with respect to a containing parent sequence.

Parameters:
parent - the SequenceFragmentMetadata representing a larger sequence in which this one is contained
sequenceName - a String identifier for this sequence
startPosition - the index in the parent sequence of the first symbol in this sequence
length - the length of this sequence

SequenceFragment

public SequenceFragment(SequenceFragmentMetadata parent,
                        String sequenceName,
                        long startPosition,
                        SequenceReader in,
                        long desiredlength,
                        SequenceSpectrumScanner scanner)

SequenceFragment

public SequenceFragment(SequenceFragmentMetadata parent,
                        String sequenceName,
                        long startPosition,
                        SequenceReader in,
                        long desiredlength,
                        SequenceSpectrumScanner scanner,
                        long length)
Convenience constructor, creates a new SequenceFragment by applying a SequenceSpectrumScanner to an input stream, and using the resulting SequenceSpectrum as the base spectrum.

Parameters:
parent - the SequenceFragmentMetadata representing a larger sequence in which this one is contained
sequenceName - a String identifier for this sequence
startPosition - the index in the parent sequence of the first symbol in this sequence
in - the SequenceReader providing the input sequence
desiredlength - the number of symbols to attempt to read from the input stream
scanner - the SequenceSpectrumScanner to use
Throws:
IOException - when an input/output error occurs on the reader
FilterException - when the scanner is filtering the sequence while reading it, but the filter throws an exception
NotEnoughSequenceException - when the reader cannot supply the desired amound of sequence (some scanners may not throw this exception, but instead simply return a Kcount based on the short sequence)

equalValue

public boolean equalValue(SequenceFragment other)
Test whether the given object is the same as this one. Differs from equals() in that implementations of this interface may contain additional state which make them not strictly equal; here we're only interested in whether they're equal as far as this interface is concerned, i.e., for purposes of clustering.

Specified by:
equalValue in interface edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.Clusterable<SequenceFragment>
Parameters:
other - The clusterable object to compare against
Returns:
True if they are equivalent, false otherwise

fireUpdated

public void fireUpdated(SequenceSpectrum source)
Indicates that the sequence statistics have changed in some way, such that any derived statistics must be recomputed. Since the provided SequenceSpectrum has changed, it must become the new base spectrum, since otherwise the existing base would be inconsistent.

Parameters:
source - the SequenceSpectrum representing the updated statistics

getSpectrum

public <X extends SequenceSpectrum> SequenceSpectrum getSpectrum(Class<X> c,
                                                                 com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactory<X> factory)
                             throws SequenceSpectrumException
Provides a SequenceSpectrum of the requested type. If the spectrum has already been computed, it is returned. If not, a new SequenceSpectrum of the requested type is created using the given factory with this SequenceFragment as the constructor argument. Thus, the specific SequenceSpectrum constructor can call this method again to request a SequenceSpectrum of a different type, from which the requested one is then derived. This mechanism assumes that a spectrum of a given class always has the same value-- that is, that it doesn't make sense to store multiple spectra of the same class associated with the same SequenceFragment. If in fact the spectra have some parameters associated with their computation, then this isn't really true, and can create confusion.

Parameters:
c - the Class of a SequenceSpectrum implementation that is requested
Returns:
the SequenceSpectrum of the requested type describing statistics of this sequence
Throws:
SequenceSpectrumException - when a spectrum of the requested type cannot be found or generated

removeOverlaps

public Set<SequenceFragment> removeOverlaps(Collection<SequenceFragment> remove)
                                     throws SequenceException
Careful: this does not propagate labels to the subsidiary fragments, because they may or may not apply. These fragments should be labelled after being split, not before.

Parameters:
remove -
Returns:
Throws:
SequenceException

setIgnoreEdges

public void setIgnoreEdges(boolean b)

spectrumEquals

public boolean spectrumEquals(SequenceSpectrum spectrum)
Test whether this sequence has statistics matching the given spectrum. A spectrum of this sequence is generated that is of the same type as the given spectrum such that they may be compared. The statistical equivalence reported naturally depends on the particular statistics being compared (that is, on the specific SequenceSpectrum implementation).

Parameters:
spectrum - the SequenceSpectrum to compare
Returns:
True if the spectra are equivalent, false otherwise
See Also:
SequenceSpectrum.spectrumEquals(SequenceSpectrum)
